Text.Page:
You helped restore {@Rgn:47001$$Tirkai Forest} and advanced Yasring's and the Mysterium's argon research in {@Rgn:45001$$Thrallhold}. Ronalt, curious about the life energy coming from some argon structures tried to purify argonified animals, but failed.

You witnessed the transformation of small argons into other forms, including inanimate buildings. The Mysterium asked you to find out more about this. You went to meet Yasring, but couldn't find her.

[(It's a message from Yasring.)

I'm studying the argons in {@Rgn:45001$$Thrallhold}. I need your help.
Yasring? She came here to pick up a few reagents and left again to take a look at some argon construction.
<PCNAME>! I hope I didn't interrupt anything important, but I just had to have your help with this.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"No, I'm glad you wrote me."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

I've been discovering things about these argon structures—things that would make Elinu wake up and weep.

I wrote up some notes for Mitiel. He's been doing lots of research into what the argons left behind. Could you take it to him?
Yes? Is there something you needed?<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"This is from Yasring."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>
I'll look this over. Ronalt wants to meet you. You should find him.

We're all working on different aspects of what the argons left behind—plants, animals, even buildings that have been horribly transformed.

Kupan here found a source of bits of argon armor. Unfortunately, he ran into a problem and could use your help.

That's right. I can source anything from soup to nuts. Mmm...I'm hungry.

Some armor fragments were on their way, but are just a bit overdue.

I hope they weren't attacked. Will you look for the shipment at the rendezvous site? Churimon should be with it.

I'll just find some lunch.

Kupan sent you? We're saved!

Our back wheel got stuck, and when I saw monsters, I ran.

Could you take a look at the wagon?
(Churimon was right. The back wheel is stuck.)

I saw it run off. Got to love enchanted wagons, eh?

At least we didn't lose Kupan's shipment. Tell him we'll be there soon.

Say, why don't you come see me at {@Rgn:45009$$Camp Insanity} some time? All the best argon research happens there.

Your assistance with the wagon is much appreciated. Churimon's work might well benefit us all.

As it happens, Churimon would like to speak with you again.

, I need {@Creature:245#2009$$Ronalt} to take a look at a new research site I stumbled on. I don't want him to get killed in the process, so please accompany him to my new research site. Time is of the essence!

What's all this about? I've never seen {@Creature:245#2011$$Churimon} so excited.

A new research site, eh? Sounds intriguing. Go on ahead—I'll meet you at the research site.

This is terrible! If my readings here are accurate, anything can become argonified. Anything at all.

Get back to camp, but get me some argonized plants on the way. We have to get to the bottom of this or we'll all become argons.
We've got everything we need. Let's begin.
Argonized plants! I need samples of them!

It's all about turning the argonomorphing frequencies back on themselves so that they dissipate. That's the theory anyway.

So here's the potion. We'll try it on some poor argonomorph creature, and see what happens.
(Use Ronalt's potion.)
That's not exactly the expected result. Something is missing, but what? Take these research notes to Mitiel. He may spot my mistake.

Even though the outcome wasn't what we hoped, Ronalt was on the right track. I think you should consult with Yasring and Rancien at the Three Towers.

Take your questions, and Ronalt's research, to Rancien.
Looking for {@creature:245#2001$$Yasring}? She left already. She's in the {@Rgn:46001$$Three Towers}.
